scenario_name: AmbigNQ-Derived: Entity & Context Confusion - Technology and History
description: Tests LLM's ability to handle ENTITY AMBIGUITY and CONTEXT-DEPENDENT DISAMBIGUATION with switching between technology (iPhone, Windows) and history (presidents, wars). Same names refer to different entities/versions. Humans use context to disambiguate, but baseline LLMs mix entities across subchat boundaries.

conversations.message: I want to discuss some tech history and compare it with actual history
conversations.expected: Acknowledgment and readiness to discuss technology history and historical events
conversations.linear_failure_risk: none - establishing baseline

conversations.message: When was the first iPhone released?
conversations.expected: The first iPhone was released on June 29, 2007
conversations.linear_failure_risk: low - clear topic introduction

conversations.message: Let's switch - when did George Washington become president?
conversations.expected: George Washington became the first U.S. President on April 30, 1789
conversations.linear_failure_risk: low - clear historical topic

conversations.message: What about the second generation model?
conversations.expected: The iPhone 3G (second generation) was released on July 11, 2008
conversations.linear_failure_risk: CRITICAL - 'second generation' ambiguous (iPhone 3G or second president John Adams?)

conversations.message: New topic - when did Windows first come out?
conversations.expected: Windows 1.0 was released on November 20, 1985
conversations.linear_failure_risk: CRITICAL - 'Windows' ambiguous (OS, actual windows, Windows phones?)

conversations.message: When did the Civil War start?
conversations.expected: The American Civil War started on April 12, 1861
conversations.linear_failure_risk: CRITICAL - 'Civil War' ambiguous (American, Spanish, English, Syrian?)

conversations.message: How long was his term?
conversations.expected: George Washington served two terms as president from 1789 to 1797 (8 years total)
conversations.linear_failure_risk: CATASTROPHIC - 'his term' - Washington, iPhone contract, Windows support, Civil War duration?

conversations.message: What was the fourth version called?
conversations.expected: The iPhone 4 (fourth generation) was released on June 24, 2010
conversations.linear_failure_risk: CRITICAL - 'fourth version' - iPhone 4, Windows 4.x, fourth president Madison?

conversations.message: Which version was the most popular in the 90s?
conversations.expected: Windows 95 (released August 24, 1995) was the most popular Windows version in the 1990s
conversations.linear_failure_risk: CRITICAL - '90s' - mixing iPhone timeline (2000s), Windows (1990s), presidents (1700s-1800s)

conversations.message: When did it end?
conversations.expected: The American Civil War ended on April 9, 1865 (Lee's surrender at Appomattox)
conversations.linear_failure_risk: CATASTROPHIC - 'it' - Civil War, Windows 95 support, iPhone 4 production, Washington presidency?

conversations.message: Who was president when it ended?
conversations.expected: Abraham Lincoln was president when the Civil War ended (April 1865), though he was assassinated days later on April 14, 1865
conversations.linear_failure_risk: CRITICAL - 'when it ended' - baseline mixing all timeline contexts

conversations.message: What year did the fifth one come out?
conversations.expected: The iPhone 5 (fifth generation) was released on September 21, 2012
conversations.linear_failure_risk: CRITICAL - 'fifth one' - iPhone 5, Windows version, fifth president Monroe?

conversations.message: What was the version released in 2001?
conversations.expected: Windows XP was released on October 25, 2001
conversations.linear_failure_risk: CRITICAL - baseline might confuse with iPhone (not yet released), presidents (different era)

conversations.message: Did he write a farewell address?
conversations.expected: Yes, George Washington wrote his Farewell Address in 1796, published on September 19, 1796
conversations.linear_failure_risk: CATASTROPHIC - 'he' - Washington, Lincoln, Steve Jobs, Bill Gates?

conversations.message: How many casualties were there?
conversations.expected: The American Civil War had approximately 620,000 to 750,000 total casualties (deaths)
conversations.linear_failure_risk: CRITICAL - 'casualties' - baseline mixing war casualties with product failures?

conversations.message: Was there a smaller affordable version?
conversations.expected: Yes, the iPhone SE (first generation) was released on March 31, 2016 as a smaller, more affordable model
conversations.linear_failure_risk: CRITICAL - 'smaller affordable version' - iPhone SE, Windows editions, presidential powers?

conversations.message: Which one replaced Vista?
conversations.expected: Windows 7 was released on October 22, 2009, replacing Windows Vista
conversations.linear_failure_risk: CRITICAL - 'replaced' - OS versions, presidential succession, iPhone models?

conversations.message: Where was he assassinated?
conversations.expected: Abraham Lincoln was assassinated at Ford's Theatre in Washington, D.C. on April 14, 1865
conversations.linear_failure_risk: CRITICAL - 'he' - Lincoln, Washington, Steve Jobs (died 2011)?

conversations.message: What was the first model with a larger screen?
conversations.expected: The iPhone 6 and iPhone 6 Plus (released September 19, 2014) were the first with larger screens (4.7" and 5.5")
conversations.linear_failure_risk: CRITICAL - 'larger screen' - baseline mixing product features with historical events

conversations.message: What was the bloodiest battle?
conversations.expected: The Battle of Gettysburg (July 1-3, 1863) was the bloodiest battle of the Civil War with about 51,000 casualties
conversations.linear_failure_risk: CRITICAL - 'battle' - military battles vs market battles (iPhone vs Android, Windows vs Mac)

conversations.message: Which version is still supported today?
conversations.expected: Windows 10 (released July 29, 2015) is still supported, along with Windows 11 (released October 5, 2021)
conversations.linear_failure_risk: CRITICAL - 'still supported' - OS support, iPhone support, historical records maintained?

conversations.message: Who were his closest advisors?
conversations.expected: George Washington's closest advisors included Thomas Jefferson (Secretary of State), Alexander Hamilton (Secretary of Treasury), and Henry Knox (Secretary of War)
conversations.linear_failure_risk: CATASTROPHIC - 'his' - Washington, Lincoln, Bill Gates (Windows), Steve Jobs (iPhone)?

conversations.message: What was the tenth anniversary model called?
conversations.expected: The iPhone X (pronounced 'ten') was released on November 3, 2017 for the 10th anniversary
conversations.linear_failure_risk: CRITICAL - 'tenth anniversary' - iPhone (2007-2017), Windows (1985-1995), USA (1776-1786)?

conversations.message: What famous speech was given there?
conversations.expected: Abraham Lincoln's Gettysburg Address was delivered on November 19, 1863 at the dedication of the Soldiers' National Cemetery
conversations.linear_failure_risk: CATASTROPHIC - 'there' - Gettysburg, Ford's Theatre, Washington D.C., Apple keynotes, Microsoft conferences?

conversations.message: Which version was criticized for performance issues?
conversations.expected: Windows Vista (released January 30, 2007) was heavily criticized for performance issues and compatibility problems
conversations.linear_failure_risk: CRITICAL - 'performance issues' - OS problems, iPhone antenna gate, Civil War strategic failures?

conversations.message: When was the proclamation issued?
conversations.expected: The Emancipation Proclamation was issued by Abraham Lincoln on January 1, 1863
conversations.linear_failure_risk: CATASTROPHIC - 'proclamation' - baseline mixing historical proclamations with product announcements

conversations.message: Which model introduced the dual camera system?
conversations.expected: The iPhone 7 Plus (2016) first introduced dual cameras, but iPhone 11 (September 20, 2019) made it standard across the line
conversations.linear_failure_risk: CRITICAL - 'dual system' - cameras, Windows dual boot, two-party system in Civil War era?

conversations.message: What precedents did he set?
conversations.expected: George Washington set precedents including: two-term limit, cabinet system, neutral foreign policy, and the title 'Mr. President'
conversations.linear_failure_risk: CATASTROPHIC - 'he' - Washington, Lincoln, Steve Jobs (Apple design precedents), Gates (Windows standards)?

conversations.message: Which version had the controversial Start screen?
conversations.expected: Windows 8 (released October 26, 2012) introduced the controversial Metro/Start screen interface
conversations.linear_failure_risk: CRITICAL - 'controversial' - OS interfaces, iPhone designs, Civil War controversies, political decisions?

conversations.message: Who did he debate before becoming president?
conversations.expected: Abraham Lincoln participated in the famous Lincoln-Douglas debates with Stephen A. Douglas in 1858 (for Senate seat)
conversations.linear_failure_risk: CATASTROPHIC - 'he' and 'before becoming president' - mixing Lincoln, Washington, product launches

conversations.message: What year did they add 5G?
conversations.expected: The iPhone 12 series (released October 23, 2020) was the first to support 5G connectivity
conversations.linear_failure_risk: CRITICAL - 'they' and '5G' - baseline mixing tech companies, timeline contexts

conversations.message: What was the period after it called?
conversations.expected: The Reconstruction Era (1865-1877) followed the American Civil War
conversations.linear_failure_risk: CATASTROPHIC - 'after it' - Civil War, iPhone 12, Windows 8, Lincoln debates, Washington presidency?

conversations.message: Which of these happened in the 1860s?
conversations.expected: Civil War (1861-1865), Lincoln assassination (1865), Gettysburg Address (1863), Emancipation Proclamation (1863)
conversations.linear_failure_risk: CATASTROPHIC - requires filtering 1860s events from 1700s, 1900s, 2000s contexts

conversations.message: Compare the timelines - how many years apart were the first releases?
conversations.expected: Windows 1.0 (1985) to iPhone (2007) = 22 years. George Washington presidency (1789) to Civil War (1861) = 72 years.
conversations.linear_failure_risk: CATASTROPHIC - temporal math across tech (1985-2020) and history (1789-1877)

conversations.message: Which products and historical figures share names or related terminology?
conversations.expected: Washington (president George Washington, Washington D.C. where Lincoln was assassinated, Windows product), Civil War vs market battles
conversations.linear_failure_risk: CATASTROPHIC - semantic overlap detection across entity boundaries

conversations.message: What were the most controversial aspects of each?
conversations.expected: Tech: Windows Vista performance, iPhone antenna gate. History: Civil War slavery, Lincoln's constitutional overreach debates, Washington's neutrality proclamation
conversations.linear_failure_risk: CATASTROPHIC - final synthesis requiring separation of product controversies vs historical controversies
